In recent New York news, over $1M of fentanyl was seized in the Bronx, a partial building collapse occurred without injuries, and thousands of hospital workers went on strike, while Governor Hochul unveiled plans for environmental initiatives and increased support for older adults.

### Risks & Alerts

- Over $1M of fentanyl recovered from packaging mill in Bronx apartment building. [↗](https://news.google.?oc=5)
- No injuries reported after partial building collapse in the Bronx, officials say. [↗](https://news.google.com/rss/articles/CBMiqgFBVV95cUxOekJDUFE3N2hKcjA5YTF4ODliYnZHNVVQNEtLUGdKS0xxQ0c5T1FmZzQ0ZXRibFA4d3pyNm5aaUtzaVBoQmNsTmgxZ3lOODduX2R4NnIzbnhESi0xYWZwS0pQZU9XWGFSSkJVLVF5MUhMUXZRbXQ3VkNSN2xJY0Vybk02WTZEUDQzeXh2SmI4TllfMXZObGJRbmJrRE5sR3kxa2h6UGNLTmlBZw?oc=5)
- FDNY responds to crash reported on Staten Island Expressway. [↗](https://news.google.?oc=5)
